answerText: Petrarch [or Francesco Petrarca][10] Petrarch wrote "I have a thousand births and deaths a day/So far is my salvation's port from me," in this collection of 317 sonnets, about half of which are written to Laura before her death and the other half after.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Yale B + Bellarmine  | 9 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: At the height of his fame as the first poet-laureate since ancient times, this man wrote the Secretum, in which St Augustine berates him for his faults and sins. For 10 points each: [10] Name this Italian "Father of Humanism," whose namesake octet and sestet sonnets had an enormous effect on the European traditions of love poetry.
